2/4/26, 2:15 PM Printing PDF and PostScript files on the InfoPrint 5000 printer Models AS1 and AD1/2 - Jenski - Test portal- RPD Linux
Configuring
Configuring / Preparing to use workflows / Workflows for printing / Printing PDF and PostScript files on the InfoPrint 5000 printer Models AS1 and AD1/2
Printing PDF and PostScript files on the InfoPrint 5000 printer Models AS1 and AD1/2
To send PDF and PostScript files to the hot folders on the InfoPrint 5000 printer Models AS1 and AD1/2 with RICOH ProcessDirector for Linux,
you can set up a workflow that uses the CopyToFolder step.
To send PDF and PostScript files to an InfoPrint 5000 hot folder, you must:
Verify that the Samba open source client is installed on your primary system.
Define a workflow that includes a CopyToFolder step.
Make sure that your primary Linux system is connected to the InfoPrint 5000 printer.
In this section:
Verifying that Samba open source client is installed
To print to an InfoPrint 5000 printer hot folder from RICOH ProcessDirector for Linux requires the Samba open source client.
Defining a workflow to submit a file to an InfoPrint 5000 hot folder
To submit a print job to a hot folder on an InfoPrint 5000, you must create a workflow that uses the CopyToFolder step.
Connecting to the InfoPrint 5000 hot folder
To copy files into a hot folder on an InfoPrint 5000, that hot folder must be mounted to the RICOH ProcessDirector primary server.
Parent topic: Workflows for printing
